t: Proverbs 20
Wine*pn is a mocker, beer is a brawler; whoever*ln goes astray because of them is not wise.
A*pn king’s terrible wrath is like the roaring of a lion; anyone*ln who provokes him endangers himself.
Honor*pn belongs to the person who ends a dispute, but*ln any fool can get himself into a quarrel.
The*pn slacker does not plow during planting season; at*ln harvest time he looks, and there is nothing.
Counsel*pn in a person’s heart is deep water; but*ln a person of understanding draws it out.
Many*pn a person proclaims his own loyalty, but*ln who can find a trustworthy person?
A*pn righteous person acts with integrity; his*ln children who come after him will be happy.
A*pn king sitting on a throne to judge separates*ln out all evil with his eyes.
Who*pn can say, “I have kept my heart pure; I*ln am cleansed from my sin”?
Differing*pn weights and varying measures— both*ln are detestable to the Lord.*s
Even*pn a young man is known by his actions — by*ln whether his behavior is pure and upright.
The*pn hearing ear and the seeing eye — the*ln Lord*s made them both.
Don’t*pn love sleep, or you will become poor; open*ln your eyes, and you’ll have enough to eat.
“It’s*pn worthless, it’s worthless!” the buyer says, but*ln after he is on his way, he gloats.
There*pn is gold and a multitude of jewels, but*ln knowledgeable lips are a rare treasure.
Take*pn his garment, for*ln he has put up security for a stranger; get*ln collateral if it is for foreigners.
Food*pn gained by fraud is sweet to a person, but*ln afterward his mouth is full of gravel.
Finalize*pn plans with counsel, and*ln wage war with sound guidance.
The*pn one who reveals secrets is a constant gossip; avoid*ln someone with a big mouth.
Whoever*pn curses his father or mother— his*ln lamp will go out in deep darkness.
An*pn inheritance gained prematurely will*ln not be blessed ultimately.
Don’t*pn say, “I will avenge this evil!” Wait*ln on the Lord,*s and he will rescue you.
Differing*pn weights are detestable to the Lord,*s and*ln dishonest scales are unfair.
Even*pn a courageous person’s steps are determined by the Lord,*s so*ln how can anyone understand his own way?
It*pn is a trap for anyone to dedicate something rashly and*ln later to reconsider his vows.
A*pn wise king separates out the wicked and*ln drives the threshing wheel over them.
The*pn Lord’s*s lamp sheds light on a person’s life, searching*ln the innermost parts.
Loyalty*pn and faithfulness guard a king; through*ln loyalty he maintains his throne.
The*pn glory of young men is their strength, and*ln the splendor of old men is gray hair.
Lashes*pn and wounds purge away evil, and*ln beatings cleanse the innermost parts.
